cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles SE of Grand Cayman and 100 miles WSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, expected to cross western Cuba Friday, then track across the southeast and central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana/Mississippi) late Sunday

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba; Cayman Islands; northern Gulf Coast from western Florida Panhandle westward to Texas
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands may bring gusty winds; chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds only about 8%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water rise (<3 ft) possible along the immediate coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1â€’3 inches possible in squalls, isolated pockets up to 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Gulf beaches could affect port operations
